intro: Tofieldia glabra, commonly known as slender tofieldia, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a panicle inflorescence, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Tofieldia glabra is a perennial species that spreads through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in its native habitat.
